name: Lidocaine Hydrochloride
indications: lidocaine hydrochloride injection indicated adult pediatric patients production local regional anesthesia analgesia surgery , dental , oral surgery procedures , diagnostic therapeutic procedures , obstetrical procedures . concentrations presentations lidocaine hydrochloride injection recommended type block indicated produce local regional anesthesia analgesia [ ( 2.2 ) ] .
contraindications: • full prescribing information recommended dosages information adult pediatric patients
warningsAndPrecautions: storage : store 20° 25°c ( 68° 77°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] . protect light . discard unused portion . lidocaine hydrochloride injection , usp sterile , nonpyrogenic , clear , colorless , isotonic solution supplied follows : lidocaine hydrochloride injection usp , 1 % ( 10 mg/ml ) : 10 x 2 ml single-dose vials ndc 31722-117-34 25 x 2 ml single-dose vials ndc 31722-117-31 10 x 5 ml single-dose vials ndc 31722-117-35 25 x 5 ml single-dose vials ndc 31722-117-32 25x 30 ml single-dose vials ndc 31722-117-33 lidocaine hydrochloride injection usp , 2 % ( 20 mg/ml ) : 10 x 2 ml single-dose vials ndc 31722-118-33 25 x 2 ml single-dose vials ndc 31722-118-31 10 x 5 ml single-dose vials ndc 31722-118-34 25 x 5 ml single-dose vials ndc 31722-118-32
adverseReactions: lidocaine hydrochloride injection contraindicated patients known hypersensitivity lidocaine local anesthetics amide type components lidocaine hydrochloride injection .
indications_original:
Lidocaine hydrochloride injection is indicated in adult and pediatric patients for the production of local or regional anesthesia or analgesia for surgery, dental, and oral surgery procedures, diagnostic and therapeutic procedures, and for obstetrical procedures. Specific concentrations and presentations of lidocaine hydrochloride injection are recommended for each type of block indicated to produce local or regional anesthesia or analgesia
 
  [see Dosage and Administration (
  
   2.2)].
contraindications_original: • See Full Prescribing Information for recommended dosages and administration information for adult and pediatric patients
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Storage:Store at 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F) [see USP Controlled Room Temperature]. Protect from light. Discard unused portion. 
  
                       Lidocaine Hydrochloride Injection, USP is a sterile, nonpyrogenic, clear, colorless, isotonic solution and is supplied as follows: 
  
                       Lidocaine Hydrochloride Injection USP, 1% (10 mg/mL): 
  
                       10 x 2 mL Single-Dose Vials                                     NDC 31722-117-34 
    25 x 2 mL Single-Dose Vials                                     NDC 31722-117-31 
    10 x 5 mL Single-Dose Vials                                     NDC 31722-117-35 
    25 x 5 mL Single-Dose Vials                                     NDC 31722-117-32 
    25x 30 mL Single-Dose Vials                                    NDC 31722-117-33 
  
                       Lidocaine Hydrochloride Injection USP, 2% (20 mg/mL): 
  
                       10 x 2 mL Single-Dose Vials                                     NDC 31722-118-33 
    25 x 2 mL Single-Dose Vials                                     NDC 31722-118-31 
    10 x 5 mL Single-Dose Vials                                     NDC 31722-118-34 
    25 x 5 mL Single-Dose Vials                                     NDC 31722-118-32
adverseReactions_original: Lidocaine hydrochloride injection is contraindicated in patients with a known hypersensitivity to lidocaine or to any local anesthetics of the amide type or to other components of lidocaine hydrochloride injection.
